intro: Cyperus andreanus var. yguazensis, commonly known as the Yguazé sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South America, particularly found in Brazil. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its triangular stems and narrow leaves. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its flowering spikes are usually green or reddish, and it produces small, wind-pollinated flowers. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
